casebody.data:
Fred F. REASONER, as Receiver, etc., Appellant, v. Charles D. WILDER et al., Appellees. No. 93. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Dec. 14, 1936. Albert T. Wilkinson, of Camden, N. Y., for appellant. James C. Feeney, of Mexico, N. Y., for Charles D. Wilder. J. & W. M. Gallagher, of Cleveland, N. Y., for defendants Fred B. Rich and H. Louis Wallace. Merritt A. Switzer, of Pulaski, N. Y., for defendants Grant Farrington and Hart-well Douglass. Lynn W. Smith, of Pulaski, N. Y., for defendant Walter A. Cuthbertson. Estabrook, Estabrook & Harding, of Syracuse, N. Y. (William H. Harding, of Syracuse, N. Y., of counsel), for defendant Syracuse Trust Co. as executor.

Before MANTON, AUGUSTUS N. HAND, and CHASE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed on the authority of Meeker v. Brewer (C.C.A.2) 86 F.(2d) 645, decided November 30, 1936.
